name: 策略管理
description:
Strategic management deals with decisions that fundamentally influence the direction of the organization and effective implementation of the direction chosen. Strategic management examines the organizational structure, resources & capabilities, and the strategic positioning of the organization to create, capture and sustain competitive advantage. In addition to economic value creation, management also must make decisions concerning the distribution of this economic value.
In this course we integrate these views together by taking the unique perspective of the situational problems of the general manager.  The general manager's primary responsibility is to diagnose the critical factors that require attention in complex business situations and to find workable solutions to strategic and organizational problems. To solve such business problems, the general manager must be capable of understanding and using knowledge from each functional area to provide a "total business" (systems) perspective on issues pertaining to strategic management. Thus, I will introduce a STRATEGY MATRIX (策略矩陣) developed by professor Seetoo (司徒達賢) as an exemplar to describe and analysis the business strategy of a particular company.
This course focuses on key issues in formulating and implementing strategies to create and sustain competitive advantage.  Emphasis is given to developing pragmatic and action-oriented general management skills.  Extant theory within the fields of strategy, accounting, economics, finance, inter- national business, marketing, political science and organization theory have important implications for general management. Thus, this course emphasizes cases and lecture/discussions.

syllabus:
Course Requirements
===================

*   **Meaningful Participation**

Informed and engaged participation is an essential part of this class and is expected of everyone. Learning opportunities are maximized when you actively engage in class discussion. Active engagement means that you are listening carefully to your peers and seeking opportunities to make comments that move the class discussion forward. Please feel free to ask questions. Be respectful, but make your opinions known.

*   **Case Presentation**

For enhancing discussion, each case will be presented by one group before case discussion.

*   **Case Write-ups**

Each participant needs to submit write-ups answering questions posted on Moodle for **four** cases (eigher A series or B series). The write-ups should be within **one page** and submitted by **Sunday midnights** (12:00 a.m.) before class dates. Before submitting your personal reports, you could discuss with other class participants. The comprehensiveness of different decision factors in your analyses will be important in the assessment of the written cases. Organize the analysis to facilitate your arguments. Frame your arguments in such a way as to guide the reader through the logic of your analyses and to ‘sell’ your recommendations. Please analyze the data provided to provide evidence-based arguments. Think critically. Your grade will reflect the depth of your analysis and your ability to defend your recommendations.

*   **Business Projects**

Each group will collaborate with one client. The goal is to propose ways to solve the issues raised by the client. Issues might involve operation improvement, strategic diagnosis or business proposal preperation. The process might include proposing to the business and subsequently revising according to the client’s feedback. Grades of this project will depend on the reports and oral presentation.
